verses.verse: {Warning against Sexual Immorality} d My son, pay attention to my wisdom, and listen closely to my insight,
so you may carefully practice {Lit. guard} discretion and your lips preserve knowledge.
For the lips of an adulteress drip honey, and her speech {Lit. palate} is smoother than oil.
But in the end she is as bitter as wormwood, {Wormwood is a plant with an extremely bitter taste.} and as sharp as a double-edged sword.
Her feet go down to death; her steps lead to Sheol. {I. e. the realm of the dead}
You aren't thinking about {Or She does not consider} where her life is headed; her steps wander, but you do not realize {Or she does not realize} it.
Now, children, {Or sons} listen to me. Don't turn away from what I am saying. {Lit. from the words of my mouth}
Keep {Lit. Keep your path} far away from her, and don't go near the entrance to her house,
so that you don't give your honor to others, and waste your best years; {Lit. and your years to the cruel}

so that strangers don't enrich themselves at your expense, {Lit. don't satisfy themselves with your strength} and your work won't end up the possession of foreigners. {Lit. won't go into a foreigner's house}
You will cry out in anguish when your end comes, when your flesh and body are consumed,
and you will say, "How I hated instruction, {Or discipline} and my heart rejected correction!
I did not obey my teachers and did not listen {Lit. incline my ear} to my instructors.
Now I am at the point of utter disaster in {Lit. in the midst of} the assembly and in the congregation."
{The Delights of Marital Faithfulness} d Drink water from your own cistern, and fresh {Lit. flowing} water from your own well.
Should your springs flow outside, or streams of water in the street?
They should be for you alone and not for strangers who are with you.
Let your fountain be blessed and enjoy the wife of your youth.
Like a loving deer, a beautiful doe, let her breasts satisfy you all the time. Be constantly intoxicated by her love.
Why should you be intoxicated by an adulteress, my son, and embrace the bosom of a foreign woman?
Indeed, what a man does is {Lit. Indeed, a man's ways are} always in the Lord's presence, {Lit. in front of the Lord's eyes} and he weighs all his paths.
The wicked person's iniquities will capture him, and he will be held with the cords of his sin.
He will die for lack of discipline, and he goes astray because of his great folly.
